title: Why was a black hole never photographed before? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because they’re far far away. For instance, the M87 is about 55 million light years in distance from the Earth. That’s 5.2*10^23 m. We lacked the technology necessary to build the necessary equipment for taking an image. I’d also like to point out that the M87 picture was not a photograph, but rather an image generated with data across various telescopes ’round the Earth. Cheers!
